headline: Behind the 'one in, one out' deal with London, migrant lives remain in limbo
subhead: At least 50 people who crossed the Channel to England have been sent back to France under a new migration deal, with several describing harsh detention conditions and fears of being denied asylum.

headline: The renaissance of the Kariri Indigenous people in northeastern Brazil
subhead: Having inhabited the semi-desert region of Sertao for thousands of years, the population was exterminated by Portuguese colonists. Today, several hundred people openly reclaim their heritage and are proudly celebrating their culture.

headline: Orson Welles, the magician of all media at the Cinémathèque française
subhead: Forty years after the titan's death and 110 years after his birth, a major exhibition and retrospective offer a portrait of this brilliant jack-of-all-trades who endlessly blurred the lines between truth and fiction.

headline: Heroes' Memorial in Kyiv carries the pain of all Ukraine
subhead: Spontaneously created after the Russian invasion, this self-managed memorial honoring fallen soldiers has become a central site for civilians and military personnel alike.

headline: First loves: '20 years later, our bodies recognize each other, it's crazy'
subhead: They met, fell in love and then parted ways. Life's twists and turns eventually brought them back together. Marion, 40, shares her story with Ewen, 43, who will give his version of their reunion in the next installment.
